suncertify.db
Class Data

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.Data
All Implemented Interfaces:
DBAccess, DBSearchFriendlyAccess
public final class Data
extends java.lang.Object
implements DBSearchFriendlyAccess

The data access class that implements the required public database interface DBAccess via its extension, DBSearchFriendlyAccess. All access to the database from the outside has to occur through the Singleton instance of this class. The class is thread-safe and optimized for high performance by means of a write-through cache.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Lars Kuettner

Method Detail

getInstance

public static Data getInstance(java.lang.String databaseLocation)
Factory method to get the Singleton instance of the data access class through which all database requests from the outside have to be conducted. This method may be called more than once provided the database location is the same every time.

Parameters:
databaseLocation - a string representing the path name to the database file
Returns:
the Singleton instance of the data access class
Throws:
DatabaseException - if there is a problem with either the databaseLocation parameter or the database file the parameter refers to

terminateInstance

public static void terminateInstance()
Gracefully terminates the data access mechanism.

Usually called when terminating the ContractorManager (then in the context of a shutdown hook) - or directly while unit testing.

readRecord

public java.lang.String[] readRecord(long recNo)
                              throws RecordNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: DBAccess
Reads a record from the file. Returns an array where each element is a record value.

Specified by:
readRecord in interface DBAccess
Specified by:
readRecord in interface DBSearchFriendlyAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the long value representing the record number that uniquely identifies the record to be read
Returns:
a string array representing the record-to-read
Throws:
DatabaseException - if the database file access point has been closed
RecordNotFoundException - if there is no valid record corresponding to recNo

createRecord

public long createRecord(java.lang.String[] data)
Description copied from interface: DBAccess
Creates a new record in the database (possibly reusing a deleted entry). Inserts the given data, and returns the record number of the new record.

Specified by:
createRecord in interface DBAccess
Specified by:

updateRecord

public void updateRecord(long recNo,
                         java.lang.String[] data,
                         long lockCookie)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         java.lang.SecurityException
Description copied from interface: DBAccess
Modifies the fields of a record. The new value for field n appears in data[n]. Throws SecurityException if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie.

Specified by:
updateRecord in interface DBAccess
Specified by:
updateRecord in interface DBSearchFriendlyAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the long value representing the record number that uniquely identifies the record to be updated
data - the string array representing the record with which to update the current record
lockCookie - the long value representing the cookie having been returned from an earlier call to lockRecord on the same recNo
Throws:
DatabaseException - if the database file access point has been closed
RecordNotFoundException - if there is no valid record corresponding to recNo
java.lang.SecurityException - if the record is not locked at all or if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie

                         long lockCookie)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         java.lang.SecurityException
Description copied from interface: DBAccess
Deletes a record, making the record number and associated disk storage available for reuse. Throws SecurityException if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie.

RecordNotFoundException - if there is no valid record corresponding to recNo

findByCriteria

public long[] findByCriteria(java.lang.String[] criteria)
Description copied from interface: DBAccess
Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".)

Specified by:
findByCriteria in interface DBAccess
Specified by:
findByCriteria in interface DBSearchFriendlyAccess
Parameters:
criteria - the string array representing the search criteria
Returns:
a long array of record numbers of the matching records
Throws:
DatabaseException - if the database file access point has been closed

findByCriteriaExactMatches

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.String[]> findByCriteriaExactMatches(java.lang.String[] criteria)
Description copied from interface: DBSearchFriendlyAccess
Retrieves all database records that exactly match the given criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that exactly matches criteria[n].

Specified by:
findByCriteriaExactMatches in interface DBSearchFriendlyAccess
Parameters:
criteria - the string array representing the search criteria
Returns:
a map of (record number, record data) pairs of all matching records
Throws:
DatabaseException - if the database file access point has been closed

lockRecord

public long lockRecord(long recNo)
                throws RecordNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: DBAccess
Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. Returned value is a cookie that must be used when the record is unlocked, updated, or deleted. If the specified record is already locked by a different client, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.

Specified by:
lockRecord in interface DBAccess
Specified by:
lockRecord in interface DBSearchFriendlyAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the long value representing the record number that uniquely identifies the record to be locked
Returns:
a long value representing the cookie that must be used when the record is unlocked, updated, or deleted
Throws:
DatabaseException - if the database file access point has been closed
RecordNotFoundException - if there is no valid record corresponding to recNo

unlockRecord

public void unlockRecord(long recNo,
                         long cookie)
                  throws java.lang.SecurityException
Description copied from interface: DBSearchFriendlyAccess
Releases the lock on a record. Cookie must be the cookie returned when the record was locked; otherwise throws SecurityException.

Specified by:
unlockRecord in interface DBSearchFriendlyAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the long value representing the record number that uniquely identifies the record to be unlocked
cookie - the long value representing the cookie having been returned from an earlier call to lockRecord on the same recNo
Throws:
DatabaseException - if the database file access point has been closed
java.lang.SecurityException - if the record is not locked at all or if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie
See Also:
DBAccess.lockRecord(long), DBAccess.unlock(long, long)

If the specified record is already locked by a different client, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.
